Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: மருந்தென வேண்டாவாம் யாக்கைக்கு அருந்தியது அற்றது போற்றி உணின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: No medicine is necessary for him who eats after assuring (himself) that what he has (already) eaten has been digested.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown seated before a meal. They are not eating yet.
Layered_Composition.Midground: They are first listening intently to their own body. A gentle, glowing light from their stomach area indicates that the previous meal has been fully digested ('அற்றது போற்றி').
Layered_Composition.Background: Because they only eat after confirming this, their body is shown to be perfectly healthy and radiant, with no need for any medicine. A cabinet full of medicine bottles ('மருந்து') is shown in the background, covered in dust and cobwebs, completely unnecessary.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: No medicine is needed for the body of one who eats only after ensuring their previous meal has been digested.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The glowing light of digestion is the signal to eat. The dusty, unused medicine cabinet is the result of this wise practice.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Healthy, mindful, attuned to one's body, preventative health.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A clean, bright, healthy light. The person's body has a healthy, vibrant glow. The colors are fresh and natural.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A medium shot of the person listening to their body, with the meal in front and the dusty medicine cabinet in the background.

Cultural_Anchors: Eating only after digestion ('அற்றது போற்றி உணின்')

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: a sick person, a person eating greedily, an empty medicine cabinet, text artifacts.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the 'glow of digestion'.
